name: Knights Inn Durango

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looked O.K. and we didn't want to spend a lot. We wanted quiet and it was close to a BBQ restaurant. The room was obviously very old and in need of updating. It smelled old. The bed was very old, uncomfortable, and needed to be replaced. The main kicker was the shower had mold/mildew growing in it! UGH! Wallpaper was peeling off, paint peeling, and carpet was nasty looking. Plugin charger wouldn't stay in wall because outlet was loose. Dirty place!
reviews.title: Absolutey DO NOT stay there!!! Go on down the road!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is a dump. It looks much better on the outside then on the inside. The room although large enough, was filthy and unkept. Towel racks would just fall off the wall as you walked by. They advertised breakfast which is to start at 8 am, after waiting until 8:20 for the door to be opened we were told that everything had been eaten by the people who were staying in the room next to us and that they wouldn't have anything until the next day, this included juice and coffee. Management were rude and very unorganized. We had booked on-line 2 months in advance, when I e-mailed them with a question we got no responce. When we arrived they had no record of our reservation even though I had called to confirm 4 days earlier. I'm sure any hotel or motel in Durango would be better than this place.
reviews.title: Stay away!!!

reviews.text: My husband, son and I stayed here in Nov. 2008. It was recommened by a co-worker. UGH! Don't waste your money on this nasty place. The bathroom and the sheets were clean and that is it. The pillows were flat. The room was DIRTY. We actually should not have even stayed here but it was very late etc. The carpet had so many stains on it. The room had a table and chairs in it and the cloth on the chairs was so stained. The lamp shades were ripped and the room had not been dusted in who knows when. My family and I did not walk around on the nasty floor without shoes on. There were even stains on the sides of the box springs and the bed spread. The place is right off a main road and it was very noisy. The free breakfast in the morning was dried out powdered donuts and boxed juice. The people at the front desk were rude. Do not waste your money on this place. Disgusting! I would never stay there again ever!
reviews.title: Nasty Place!

likes.liked: — We did not like anything about this place!

reviews.text: We were coming from Monument Valley via Natural Bridges NM (with a stopover at 4 corners) so we didn't know how far we'd get that day. I figured Durango or maybe Silverton.
reviews.title: I'd stay someplace else next time...

likes.liked: — No coffee maker in the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made Durango. I figured Durango was a pretty big town, there should be no problem getting a decent room, right?
reviews.title: Not great, but a place to sleep.

reviews.text: This place is older, but nicely maintained, and the staff are friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast is poor, like most Knights Inns, so don't count on it to pass for a meal.
reviews.title: Nice motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Found the Knights Inn day off while looking for hotels online that were dog friendly. The staff here was great and very informative after we told them that the visitor center was closed on the weekends. Room was clean and had great little freebie packets (my boyfriend love the razor that was included. We weren't looking for luxury when we chose this but a clean, quiet and cheap place to stay. We liked it so much we stayed an extra night. I really appreciate the dog friendliness.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Value AMAZING Town

reviews.text: This was a great motel. Old fashioned and my room was a single level. Very clean, the staff was helpful and they also left plenty of toiletries in the room.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: Kind of hate to give this review since all the others are positive. All I can really say is the improvements haven't quite made it to room 106. Black mold all over the place in the tile grout. Continental breakfast of donuts and coffee. I guess we had the option to change rooms, but we were so tired from an all day trip we just crashed. If you get room 106 just ask if it has been renovated yet.
reviews.title: Improvements "NOT"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made reservations for our visit in July in February. At this time,the rate was $48 a night. When we arrived,we were given the smaller room off a connecting room which was only slightly larger than a closet.There was no room for our luggage and the bed was small and hard.The hotel was not full,so we don't understand why we were given this tiny room other than we only paid $48.Why should we have a small room because we had the foresight to book early? On the up side, they give you little bags with toothpaste,razor and other small items you might have forgotten.The hotel staff was friendly and the motel is near a trolley stop but NOT near the train station.Overall,we enjoyed our stay in Durango and the train but disappointed in the room we were given.
reviews.title: Closet room

reviews.text: I organized the lodging for a cycling team that was in Durango for a bike race. The management was very friendly and flexible, especially with a bunch of college students. She even but icy-hot and toothpaste in our rooms, knowing, as athletes and forgettful students we may need it. She put us in the newly painted and carpeted rooms and I could tell, it looked nice. Each room had a microwave, a niced sized one, and a microwave, this was of great value to a cycling team. The beds were ok in terms of comfort and some dresser drawers didn't slide easily. Overall, a great experience and the managment is very determined to improve the Alpine Inns reputation. Also, the location was great for team, could ride to all the races.
reviews.title: Great place to stay due to NEW Management!

reviews.text: Lastly, the cycling team I organized has stayed at the Alpine Inn 3 years in a row and this time the managment was noticably better.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! would highly recommend staying here.

reviews.text: Thanks for the stay!
reviews.title: Decent place, great deal

reviews.text: Great service. Provided a nice quiet place to crash for the night.
reviews.title: New Management, Awesome Service!

reviews.text: It's certainly not as nice as some other hotels, but it's not nearly as expensive either. Plus, it's not a chain hotel, so you get a local experience.
reviews.title: don't use this place

reviews.text: Disregard the early reviews written when the Alpine Inn was under a different management. As the most recent reviews show, the current managers are providing an excellent level of customer service. The rooms were comfortably large and clean; laundry facilities were available also. The motel is at the north end of town, an advantage or disadvantage, depending on how centrally located one wished to be; however, the free trolley stops within yards of the motel--and the tourist area of Durango is an easy, if rather long, walk away. Due to its location, it was exceptionally quiet. It's unfortunate that rating under the old mangement will keep this motel from showing up better in a comparison with other motels.
reviews.title: Very Nice Motel

reviews.text: Doesn't look like much from the outside but the rooms are a decent value (for Durango) - we paid about $90 for 2 queen beds. The staff is helpful and there is coffee, tea and hot chocolate in the lobby, plus snacks and a limited continental breakfast. The rooms have a microwave and fridge and were fairly clean except for stains on some of the chairs.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: A young couple has just (March 2010) taken over management of the Alpine Inn, and bit by bit they are making it a comfortable, pleasant bargain of a place to stay. Rooms are small but clean, location is great, in walking distance of supermarket, restaurants, hiking, Durango Recreation Center, Animas River. Best of all is the cheerful, helpful attitude of the new managers. The Alpine Inn may be average now, but they're determined to make it "Very Good." Try it, you'll like it.
reviews.title: New managers turning this place around

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one week. We liked the layout of the site and its location near the north edge of town. TJ, a newly returned vet from Iraq, and his expecting spouse Julia are doing a great job of caring for the place.
reviews.title: Great new managers

reviews.text: New management, really took care of us! Rooms had fresh paint and carpet, were super clean, and there was free stuff in each room such as toothpaste, icy hot patches and other bathroom amenities. Nice location, great stay!
reviews.title: Great Place, low price

description: Located on the quiet North end of Durango, the Knights Inn offers clean, comfortable hotels rooms at a great price. We are on the complimentary Durango Trolley route with a stop right across the street. We are within walking distance of several restaurants, a grocery store and right next to the Ski Barn for those who enjoy the winter sports and need to rent equipment. Mild to Wild rafting is one block north for the summer adventures. Our helpful front desk staff and management are there to provide you with any information or recommendations you need to make your trip enjoyable.
